claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers type I interferon signaling and broadens antigen presentation.

evidence.quote: Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors
Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination combined with ICI improves tumor control and survival compared to ICI alone.

evidence.quote: Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.claim: The sensitization effect depends on type I interferon signaling and mRNA presence.

evidence.quote: Lipid particle controls lacking mRNA did not reproduce the sensitization effect.
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination creates a more targetable checkpoint axis and increases immune infiltration.

evidence.quote: Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy

claims.caveat: Tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limit direct causal interpretation.
